result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASE RECALLED AT 10:45 A.M. 
Defendant appears with Attorney Pamela Popken.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter: Nancy Szeklinski.
BTC: Bench warrant vacated, bond reinstated.
Defense states that defendant tested today with all negative results.  Defendant contacted his veteran advocate regarding the program, however, is on vacation and was not able to obtain documentation.  
BTC: Set for status in 1 week to 10 days, needs information on this program.

Defendant tested today and returned with a positive result from RCAP.
Defense requests to leave bond as is for reasons stated on the record.
BTC: Set for hearing next week, needs more information on the VA program.  No action taken on bond on this date.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the co-defendant Jazmine Gonzales. No contact with Carey Garvey and A.W.M. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jerad L Holmes appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Jerad L Holmes. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
